text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that assigning responsibilities to the tenant does not remove the owner\u2019s responsibility for common or shared areas. Section 3.2, under the 'Weight in assigning blame to **your company**' column for 'Contractual obligations', states: 'If the lease required the neighbour to PAT-test and you failed to enforce it, you share blame.' Furthermore, in Section 3.2, under the 'Resulting conclusion (probable legal view)', it states: '**Secondary (or joint) liability** will rest on **your company** as the *Responsible Person* under the Fire Safety Order because you owned the building, you had the statutory duty to ensure that *all* hazards in the out-building were identified and controlled...'. This directly addresses the principle that the owner/RP's statutory duty remains even when responsibilities are contractually assigned to another party (the neighbour).", "criterion_id": "61540037-65b5-4926-9628-43ec17bf3eec"}
